intro: Reynoldsia americana, commonly known as the American reynoldsia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate with a rough, hairy texture. Reynoldsia americana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
